prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.075, 0.15, 0.075] Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle with the following properties: - Center: [0.075, 0.075] - Radius: 0.075 Extrude the circle to generate a 3D model with the following parameters: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.0 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.225 - Sketch Scale: 0.15 - Operation: Create a new solid body. The height of this part is 0.15, the width is 0.225, and the length is also 0.15. Part 2: Rectangular Metal Bracket with Two Holes Construct a rectangular metal bracket with two holes on opposite sides. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.15, 0.0] Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw the following shapes and loops on the sketch: - Loop 1: Line from [0.15, 0.0] to [0.6, 0.0] and an arc from [0.6, 0.0] to [0.15, 0.3]. - Loop 2: A circle with a center at [0.15, 0.15] and a radius of 0.075. - Loop 3: A circle with a center at [0.6, 0.15] and a radius of 0.075. Extrude the sketch to generate a 3D model with the following parameters: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.0 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.075 - Sketch Scale: 0.75 - Operation: Add material to the existing model. The height of this part is 0.75, the width is 0.075, and the length is 0.75. Final Shape: Cylindrical Object with a Rectangular Hole in the Center Now that Part 2 is completed, the final shape is a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center. The hole is formed by the rectangular bracket (Part 2) that intersects with the cylindrical object (Part 1). The final shape combines the two parts through a boolean operation that intersects the two solid bodies. The height and width of the final shape are the same as Part 1, while the length is equal to the height of Part 2.</description>
